todos.text:
PHASE 0: SETUP & PROTOCOL (READ FIRST)

Explanations: Establish strict execution protocol, gating, and constraints before any action. The organizer is authoritative and read-only; task execution uses a queue-system interface with read-only analyzers for validation.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <TASK_ID>
python3 todo_manager.py done <TASK_ID> 0
```
IMPORTANT NOTE: [SYNTHESIZED FROM ORGANIZER] No direct writes to queue/state files by the agent. Use only read-only analyzers prior to any execution or marking done. All timestamps are ISO8601 with +08:00. Respect monotonic completion and require “IMPORTANT NOTE:” presence in every phase. The organizer is authoritative; do not alter `memory-bank/plan/organize.md`.

PHASE 1: IDENTITY CAPTURE FOUNDATIONS

Explanations: Implement guided capture for web/mobile with automated glare/blur/orientation checks and multi-frame burst support. Enforce strong input validation for ID front/back, passport MRZ, and selfie video for active/passive liveness.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <TASK_ID>
python3 todo_manager.py done <TASK_ID> 1
```
IMPORTANT NOTE: [SYNTHESIZED FROM ORGANIZER] IC1: >95% pass at 1000px width; orientation auto-correct; quality scores in [0..1]. IC2: Inputs include ID front/back, passport MRZ, selfie video; MIME/type validated; size/duration limits enforced.

PHASE 2: EVIDENCE EXTRACTION PIPELINE

Explanations: Build a robust extraction layer: document classifier, OCR/MRZ/Barcode/NFC ingestion, and face cropping for downstream matching.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <TASK_ID>
python3 todo_manager.py done <TASK_ID> 2
```
IMPORTANT NOTE: [SYNTHESIZED FROM ORGANIZER] EE1: Document classifier top-1 ≥0.9 confidence on test set. EE2: ICAO 9303 MRZ checksums pass; PDF417/QR parsed; NFC where available. EE3: Face boxes returned; min crop size 112x112.

PHASE 3: AUTHENTICITY & LIVENESS CHECKS

Explanations: Implement tamper/forgery detection, security-feature analysis, liveness (passive and challenge), and high-accuracy face match for ID vs. selfie across frames.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <TASK_ID>
python3 todo_manager.py done <TASK_ID> 3
```
IMPORTANT NOTE: [SYNTHESIZED FROM ORGANIZER] AU1: Security features (microprint/guilloché/UV where feasible) with thresholds documented per template. AU2: Tamper detection AUC ≥0.9 using ELA/noise/lighting features. AU3: Liveness FNMR ≤3%, FMR ≤1% on eval. AU4: Face match TAR@FAR1% ≥98% with multi-frame consensus.

PHASE 4: SANCTIONS & AML SCREENING

Explanations: Integrate vendor APIs for sanctions, PEP, adverse media, and watchlists; implement IP/geo checks with explainable hits surfaced in the decision layer.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <TASK_ID>
python3 todo_manager.py done <TASK_ID> 4
```
IMPORTANT NOTE: [SYNTHESIZED FROM ORGANIZER] SA1: Vendor API integrated; hit explainability available to reviewers and audit logs; IP/geo controls enabled.

PHASE 5: RISK SCORING & DECISIONING

Explanations: Combine device fingerprint, proxy/VPN/TOR detection, document validity/expiry checks, and consistency validators into an aggregate risk score (rules + ML) for approve/review/deny.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <TASK_ID>
python3 todo_manager.py done <TASK_ID> 5
```
IMPORTANT NOTE: [SYNTHESIZED FROM ORGANIZER] RS1: Proxy/VPN detection enabled with geovelocity checks. RS2: Expiry/format validators implemented against issuer formats. RS3: Calibrated thresholds with ROC/AUC reported for aggregate scoring.

PHASE 6: HUMAN REVIEW CONSOLE

Explanations: Deliver a reviewer console with PII redaction toggle and dual-control workflows for high-risk cases, enabling safe escalation and sign-off.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <TASK_ID>
python3 todo_manager.py done <TASK_ID> 6
```
IMPORTANT NOTE: [SYNTHESIZED FROM ORGANIZER] HR1: PII redaction toggle present; two-person approval enforced for high risk; actions auditable.

PHASE 7: COMPLIANCE, SECURITY, AND PRIVACY

Explanations: Ensure compliance with DPA/GDPR/CCPA and AML/KYC; implement data minimization, encryption at rest, strong key management, WORM audit logs, and retention policies; complete DPIA/ROPA with legal sign-off.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <TASK_ID>
python3 todo_manager.py done <TASK_ID> 7
```
IMPORTANT NOTE: [SYNTHESIZED FROM ORGANIZER] CP1: DPA/GDPR/CCPA; AML/KYC; NIST 800-63-3 alignment with gaps documented and tracked. CP2: AES-256 at rest; TLS1.2+; KMS/HSM; append-only (WORM) audit logs; retention policies applied; data minimization enforced. CP3: DPIA/ROPA completed; legal sign-off recorded.

PHASE 8: OPERATIONS, OBSERVABILITY, AND MODEL LIFECYCLE

Explanations: Implement observability (metrics, traces, risk distributions, FPR), SLOs, oncall alerts, AB tests, drift monitoring, periodic re-training, and fairness/bias audits.

**Concluding Step: Phase Completion Protocol**
```bash
python3 todo_manager.py show <TASK_ID>
python3 todo_manager.py done <TASK_ID> 8
```
IMPORTANT NOTE: [SYNTHESIZED FROM ORGANIZER] OP1: SLOs defined; oncall alerts wired; dashboards show risk distributions and FPR. OP2: AB tests and drift alarms configured; periodic re-training scheduled; fairness/bias audits scheduled.
